item.title: The Mulitple Latent Block Model for mixed data
item.description: body { text-align: justify} Abstract Co-clustering techniques, which group observations and features simultaneously, have proven to be efficient in summarising data sets. They exploit the dualism between rows and columns and the data set is summarized in blocks (the crossing of a row-cluster and a column-cluster). However, in the case of mixed data sets (with features of different kind), it is not easy to define a co-clustering method that takes this heterogeneity into account.
